question: Akbar promulgated Mazharnama in order to:
option1: take all the religious matters into his own hands
option2: develop a pluralistic society in India
option4: bring judiciary directly under the charge of the emperor
answer: take all the religious matters into his own hands
explanation: Akbar issued Mahzarnama (or Infallibility Decree) to take all the religious matters into his own hands.This made him supreme in the religious matters. He issued Mahzarnama to curb the dominance of Ulema. It was written by Faizi in 1579 A.D.
